greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered factorizations into distinct factors.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Arnold Knopfmacher and Michael Mays, Ordered and Unordered Factorizations of Integers, The Mathematica Journal, Vol 10 (1).
example: a(20)=5 because there are 5 ordered factorizations of 20 into distinct factors: 2*10, 4*5, 5*4, 10*2, 20.
maple: b:= proc(n, i, p) option remember; `if`(n<=i, (p+1)!, 0)+add(
b(n/d, d-1, p+1), d=select(x->x<=i, divisors(n)minus{1, n}))
results.author: _Geoffrey Critzer_, Feb 01 2015
